summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to a team, attaching a draft motion to preclude cross-examination regarding MV-1 and MV-2's drug use and MV-1's family background. The document is part of legal strategy preparation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, sending a draft motion to preclude cross-examination regarding MV-1 and MV-2's drug use and MV-1's family background.

events.title: Draft Motion to Preclude Cross-Examination
events.description: A draft motion was prepared to preclude cross-examination regarding MV-1 and MV-2's drug use and MV-1's family background.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email dated November 27, 2021, from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York.
It references a draft motion to preclude cross-examination regarding MV-1 and MV-2's drug use, with blanks left for specific facts.
The motion also includes a section on MV-1's family background, with a request for accuracy verification.
The email is addressed to a team, indicating collaborative legal strategy preparation.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting ongoing legal proceedings or preparations related to victims or witnesses.
